revisionDesc.change: Converted RNG Datatypes Declarations into ODD Datatype Macros according to TEI guidelines. Chapter 1, §1.4.2.
Converted RNG Attribute Classes Declarations into ODD Attribute Classes according to TEI guidelines. Chapter 1, §1.3.1.
Converted RNG Model Classes Declarations into ODD Model Classes according to TEI guidelines. Chapter 1, §1.3.2. See also Chapter 22, §22.4.6 for references to models.
Converted RNG Model Classes Declarations into ODD Macro Classes (when appropriate) according to TEI guidelines. Chapter 22, §22.4.7.
Converted RNG Element Declarations into ODD Element Declarations according to TEI guidelines. Chapter 22, §22.3. See also Chapter 22, §22.4.6 for references to models.
Changed order of content and attlist declarations, fixed problem generating @usage
Integrated Schematron rules within element declarations.
Integrated modules.
Added descriptions in attribute definitions
Added relatedItem element
Included new relatedItem element in the content model of the source element
Changed name of accessdesc to accessRestrict and changed references to the old name in macro.availabilityPart and useRestrict
Added scoreDef to the content of part

Added att.declaring class that supercedes source attributes. Members: music, mdiv, section, part, staff, layer, measure, back, body, div, facsimile, front, graphic, group, lg, surface, performance, recording, clip, avfile
Added members to att.datapointing class: availability, classification, correction, editorialDecl, interpretation, langUsage, normalization, projectDesc, samplingDecl, segmentation, stdVals
Added reg and authURI attributes to att.authorized
Corrected typos in the description of list
Revised description of classCode
Added classCode to att.authorized and modified its content model to be more restrictive
Revised constraintSpec for @classcode
Added att.canonical class
Moved @dbkey from att.name to att.canonical; made att.name member of att.canonical
Added performance module (analogous to facsimile module) with elements performance, recording, clip, and avfile
Added model.alignLike and model.performanceLike to the music element
On when: required use of data.ISOTIME datatype for @absolute; removed att.measurement; loosened requirement for @interval; added @inttype
On timeline: removed medialength and unit (att.measurement); substituted avref for mediacontent
Removed @reg from att.datable; added it directly to date element and att.authorized class
Corrected omission of att.width on graphic
Revised description of att.calendared
Added tupletSpan.log to att.controlevent, thereby providing att.staffident
Reordered declarations of pgHead, pgHead2, pgFoot, and pgFoot2 since model.metaLike.score_sequenceOptional seems to require it
Restricted @pos on chordDef to positiveInteger
Permitted multiple values in @staff; seems to have gotten lost somewhere along the way
Made extptr and extref members of att.internetmediatype
Removed <choice> from definition of data.COLOR
Replaced 'slash' with 'fslash' and 'bslash' in data.TEXTRENDITION
Renamed <keywords> 'termList' and added @classcode
Added model.headLike to eventList
Added descriptions of some model classes lacking them
Made @staff in att.staffident 'mandatory when applicable'
Fixed references to definition of interline distance
Added att.staffident to chord, note, rest, space that seems to have gotten lost in earlier iterations
Removed duplicate set_ns constraintSpec elements
Added constraint to check @staff values against existing staffDef @n values
Eliminated "separatedMaterial" from relatedItem @rel value list to remain in line with MODS values
Implemented harm/figured bass revision
Revised parameters for @tab.strings and @key.sig.mixed to allow a wider range of articulation signs
Revised parameter for tab.strings; now TOKEN instead of NMTOKEN
Added graphicprimitiveLike and fLike to elements in transcription class
Added plate and watermark elements to content of physDesc
Revised constraint that checked @source; now examines @decls
Documented each valItem element
Revised front matter
Documented values in macroSpec elements
Converted some element names to camelCase; changed addressline to addrLine and blockquote to quote to match TEI names
Changed names of some elements: altmeiid to altId, exhibitHist to exhibHist, pgFoot1 to pgFoot, pgHead1 to pgHead, plate to plateNum, treatmentHist to treatHist, treatmentSched to treatSched
Made annot member of att.bibl
Allowed lg as content of lg
Reworked how work-level metadata is captured: replaced profiledesc with workDesc
Made subst member of att.edit and att.trans classes
Made att.log.tie member of att.duration.timestamp in order to allow @dur (i.e., ending tstamp) on tie
Allowed music content in abbr and expan to bring them in line with other editorial elements, such as sic, corr, etc. Did not allow sectionLike, measureLike, staffLike, and layerLike
Made surface and zone members of att.datapointing
Documented surface origin as upper left corner

Accounted for "in-staff" ossia: rewrote ossia element's model, permitted ossia within measurePart and staffPart model classes, and provided constraint that only allows ossia to have staff children when ossia is a child of measure and only layer children when ossia is a child of staff
Added xml:base to att.common to support use of xi:include
Added @ns attribute to definitions of xml:id and xml:lang
Allowed caption to precede and/or follow figure and table content

Revised att.intervallicdesc/intm to support more uniform capture of melodic intervals: added new data.INTERVALAMOUNT datatype that provides directional indicators (u=up, d=down, s=same) and signed numeric values (in half steps)
Added new incipit and incipCode elements to permit capture of incipit information (textual and musical)

Added @label in att.common class to accommodate assignment of a string label to any element: left @n with NMTOKEN content, deprecated @label.full, and created att.labels.abbreviated class to hold @label.abbr
Made label member of att.typed class
Made staffdef member of att.declaring so that it can be used to point to performer element(s)
Made staffDef, layerDef and staffGrp members of att.labels.abbreviated and att.declaring

Fixed bug (probably created in switch from RNG to ODD) that dropped mensural duration values: added data.DURATION.mensural and data.DURATION.cmn datatypes, which are concatenated by new definition of data.DURATION
Added constraintSpecs that limit @n on staff, staffDef, layer, and layerDef to a single numeric value
Added shape attribute to att.fermata.vis
Added 2011-07-01 to mei-2011-05-source.xml: made att.artic.log and att.accid.log members of att.controlevent and att.staffloc; made att.dot.log member of att.controlevent.
Moved schema-defining elements from <body> to <back>.

Transitioned to anyURI instead of IDREF(S): created data.IDREF datatype, analogous to data.URI, as well as plural forms of each (IDREFS and URIS); replaced IDREF with data.URI and IDREFS with data.URIS; for consistency, replaced <rng:data type="anyURI"/> with <rng:ref name="data.URI"/>; removed schematron rules which validated IDREFs; deleted <extptr> and <extref> elements; deleted att.link.external and att.link.internal attribute classes and data.PLIST macroSpec; renamed att.link.common to att.pointing; renamed att.participantident to att.targets and added an evaluate attribute; made att.pointing a member of att.targets; made any entities that were members of att.link.(in|ex)ternal members of att.pointing; made any entities that were members of att.participantident members of att.targets.

Re-worked transition to anyURI -- Renamed att.targets class back to att.plist and added target attribute (allowing multiple URLs) to att.pointing class. Members of att.plist are now att.controlevent, annot, and expansion. Members of att.pointing are now avFile, barLine, bibl, contents, ending, graphic, lem, measure, pb, ptr, ref, rdg, and section.
Added def attribute to staff and layer that permit these elements to reference their respective definition elements.
created files for guidelines frontmatter and revisiondesc

Revised header: substituted @accid on key instead of @accid.ges; restricted content model of <contents> to prevent confusion with <relatedItem>; added <label> to model of <contents>; revise description of <label>; allowed <tempo> in macro.workPart; created new <meter> element for metadata use; added <meter> to macro.workPart; permitted multiple <role> elements in model of <performer>; added <incipText> element; revised content model of <incip>; added description and revised content model of <instrVoice> revised description and content model of <performer>; revised description of <relatedItem>; made <source> a member of att.pointing; revised description of <source>

Revised how clef changes are handled: deleted clefChange element; removed model.clefChangePart; revised description of clef element; made clef member of model.eventLike; added clefGrp element, made it a member of model.eventLike and model.staffDefPart; removed schematron constraints referring to clefChange; added schematron constraint to ensure that only one of clef or clefGrp can be used in staffdef
Added def attribute to att.staff.log and att.layer.log attribute classes; revised documentation for staff and layer.
Added cautionary attribute att.clef.log to correct omission in revision 361.
Made symbolDef a member of att.coordinated as it sometimes needs to state its coordinate system. Also, revised documentation of surface, substituting 'writing' for 'written'.

Revised data.STAFFLOC to be more compatible with existing representations and their processors: The value '0' indicates the bottom line; positive values are used for positions above the bottom line and negative values for the positions below. For example, in treble clef, 1 = F4, 2 = G4, 3 = A4, etc. and -1 = C4, -2 = B4, and so on.
